alert.note: Alert for Mariposa; Merced (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 8:39PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by other multiple causes continues. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Mariposa and Merced. * WHEN...Until 900 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Several structures are flooded and some sand bagging operations are continuing. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 837 PM PST, Flooding continues to occur in the warned area due to recent rainfall and higher flows in waterways. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Merced, Atwater, Planada and Le Grand. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
